content: The "Improving Teacher Diversity Act" is cited as the short title. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include a new section on Centers of Excellence. This section defines key terms related to the establishment of these centers. The term 'eligible institution' refers to higher education institutions with teacher preparation programs meeting specific requirements, including being part of certain categories like Hispanic-serving institutions, Tribal Colleges, Alaska Native-serving institutions, Native Hawaiian-serving institutions, or consortia of these institutions. The term 'highly qualified' refers to individuals meeting specific criteria outlined in education acts, and 'scientifically based reading research' is defined within the context of the legislation. The term 'scientifically based reading research' is defined in education legislation as per the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. SEC. 232. CENTERS OF EXCELLENCE. The Secretary is authorized to award grants to institutions to establish centers of excellence for teacher preparation programs. The grants aim to ensure teachers are highly qualified by implementing reforms, retraining faculty, and redesigning programs to incorporate advanced technology and improve student achievement. The grants aim to establish centers of excellence for teacher preparation programs that close student achievement gaps, promote strong teaching skills, provide sustained preservice clinical experience, increase interaction between faculty and teachers, and offer support for preparation time. Developing initiatives for teacher and principal retention, including mentoring and support programs, awarding scholarships based on financial need for teacher preparation, and disseminating information on effective practices for teacher certification. The text chunk discusses the application process, minimum grant amount, limitation on administrative expenses, and regulations for institutions seeking grants for teacher preparation and certification. The minimum grant amount is $500,000, with a limitation of 2% of funds for administrative expenses. Regulations will be prescribed by the Secretary to carry out the program. The Secretary is allocated $50,000,000 from unappropriated funds for fiscal years 2008-2012 to implement teacher preparation and certification programs. The authority for this program will expire at the end of fiscal year 2012.
